sen.j: 半俗半僧の少年花月と父との再会を花月の遊芸を交えて描く。
sen.e: It describes a reunion of a boy Kagetsu, who is hanzoku hanso (monk living as ordinary people), and his father, with music and dancing by Kagetsu.
It describes a reunion of a hanzoku hanso (monk living as ordinary people) boy Kagetsu and his father, incorporating music and dances performed by Kagetsu.

sen.j: 清水寺に辿り着いたワキは元筑紫国英彦山の人、左衛門である。
sen.e: A waki is Zaemon, who was formally from Hiko-san Mountain Tsukushi Province, and arrives at Kiyomizu-dera Temple.
The waki who has arrived at Kiyomizu-dera Temple is Zaemon, originally from Hiko-san Mountain in Tsukushi Province.

sen.e: The waki who has arrived at Kiyomizu-dera Temple is Zaemon, originally from Hiko-san Mountain in Tsukushi Province.

sen.j: 彼は七歳になったわが子が失踪したことに世をはかなみ出家し、諸国を巡っている。
sen.e: He entered into priesthood in despair of the world as his seven years old son went missing and he is traveling around various provinces.
He entered into priesthood in despair of the world as his seven-year-old son went missing, and is on a pilgrimage of various provinces.
sen.cmt: 適切な表現に直しました。

sen.j: 清水寺に参詣した際近所に面白いものはないかと寺男にきくと、門前に面白い遊芸をする少年（花月）がいるとのことである。
sen.e: When he visit Kiyomizu-dera Temple, he asks a temple employee if there is anything worth seeing around the temple and he is told that there is a boy (Kagetsu) in front of the gate, performing interesting music and dances.

During his visit at Kiyomizu-dera Temple he asks a temple employee if there is anything worth seeing in the neighborhood, and is told that there is a boy (Kagetsu) in front of the gate who performs interesting music and dances.

sen.j: 寺男の勧めでその少年の舞を見ると、まさに我が子であることに気付く。
sen.e: With recommendation from the temple employee, he sees a dance of the boy and realizes that the boy is his own son.
At the recommendation of the temple employee he sees the boy's dance, and realizes that the boy is his own son.
sen.cmt: 適切な表現に直しました。

sen.j: 聞けば花月は天狗に攫われ諸国の山を巡ったという。
sen.e: Kagetsu told that he was abducted by Tengu (a mountain spirit, portrayed as winged and having a long nose) and traveled mountains of various provinces.
Kagetsu says that he had been abducted by a Tengu (a mountain spirit with wings and a long nose) and traveled mountains of various provinces.

sen.j: 花月の名乗り - 自分の名前にある「花」と「月」を様々なもの（花、瓜、菓、火、果）にかけ、我こそは天下の名僧だという。
sen.e: Nanori (announcement of one's name) of Kagetsu - He claims that he is the distinguished priest of Japan by playing on words 'flower (花)' and 'moon (月)' in his name (Kagetsu writes 花 (ka) 月 (getsu)) with various things (花 (flower), 瓜 (pepo), 菓 (confectionery, 火 (fire) and 果 (result), all sounding Ka).

Nanori (announcement of one's name) of Kagetsu - He claims that he is a distinguished priest of Japan by playing on words from his name (Kagetsu uses the characters 花 [ka - flower] and 月 [getsu - moon]) using various things (such as flower, gourd, confectionery, fire and fruit, all pronounced 'ka').
